tests.title: It will success creates the 1st user, with status 201, user count = 1, return name = 'Sudoer'
tests.fullTitle: Creating Users in MongoDB It will success creates the 1st user, with status 201, user count = 1, return name = 'Sudoer'

tests.title: It will fail creates a new user because the user' email exists, and user count = 1, status 400
tests.fullTitle: Creating Users in MongoDB It will fail creates a new user because the user' email exists, and user count = 1, status 400

tests.title: It will success creates the 2nd user, and user count = 2, status 201, return name='Harry'
tests.fullTitle: Creating Users in MongoDB It will success creates the 2nd user, and user count = 2, status 201, return name='Harry'

tests.title: It will fail because lack of password field, and user count = 2, status 400, message: Path 'password' is required
tests.fullTitle: Creating Users in MongoDB It will fail because lack of password field, and user count = 2, status 400, message: Path 'password' is required

tests.title: It will success get all the users, with status 200, respone will be an array, user count = array length = 2
tests.fullTitle: Get Users in MongoDB It will success get all the users, with status 200, respone will be an array, user count = array length = 2

tests.title: It will success get a the user name "Harry", with status 200, response body object have name "Harry"
tests.fullTitle: Get Users in MongoDB It will success get a the user name "Harry", with status 200, response body object have name "Harry"

tests.title: It will fail to get a the user name "Peter", with status 404, response body is an object {} with error message "User not found"
tests.fullTitle: Get Users in MongoDB It will fail to get a the user name "Peter", with status 404, response body is an object {} with error message "User not found"
tests.code:
chai.request(app)
    .get("/users/Peter")
    .end((err, res) => {
        res.should.have.status(404)
        res.body.error.should.eql("User not found")
        done()
    })

tests.title: It will success update the user "Harry" to "Mike" with age=30 , with status 200, user count = 2
tests.fullTitle: Updating Users in MongoDB It will success update the user "Harry" to "Mike" with age=30 , with status 200, user count = 2

tests.title: It will fail to update the user because invalid input (phone) , with status 400, user count = 2, respone an object with error "Invalid updates
tests.fullTitle: Updating Users in MongoDB It will fail to update the user because invalid input (phone) , with status 400, user count = 2, respone an object with error "Invalid updates

tests.title: It will fail to update because the updated email already existed , with status 400, user count = 2, respone an object with codename "DuplicateKey"
tests.fullTitle: Updating Users in MongoDB It will fail to update because the updated email already existed , with status 400, user count = 2, respone an object with codename "DuplicateKey"

tests.title: It will fail to update because user name (Mopp) not found , with status 404, user count = 2, respone an object with error "User not found"
tests.fullTitle: Updating Users in MongoDB It will fail to update because user name (Mopp) not found , with status 404, user count = 2, respone an object with error "User not found"

tests.title: It will fail delete because not found user name "Mopp" , with status 404, response body is an object with error message "User not found", user count = 2
tests.fullTitle: Delete Users in MongoDB It will fail delete because not found user name "Mopp" , with status 404, response body is an object with error message "User not found", user count = 2

tests.title: It will success delete an user with name "Mike", with status 200, respone will be an object contain user whose name "Mike", user count = 1
tests.fullTitle: Delete Users in MongoDB It will success delete an user with name "Mike", with status 200, respone will be an object contain user whose name "Mike", user count = 1
